newsitem.title: USA: Entergy, SWEPCO proposal selected by Cajun co-ops.
newsitem.headline: Entergy, SWEPCO proposal selected by Cajun co-ops.

text.p: Eleven electric distribution cooperatives served by Cajun Electric Power Cooperative Inc voted for a reorganization plan proposed by Entergy Corp and Central & South West Corp's Southwestern Electric Power Co subsidiary, the utility said.
They also ranked the proposal as their number one preference among the competing plans, SWEPCO said.

The 11 voted to reject the plan supported by the court- appointed trustee which calls for purchase of the bankupt Louisiana power supplier by Northern States Power Co, Southern Co and Zeigler Coal Holding Co.
A third plan, put forward by Enron Corp received nine co-op votes, while one voted to reject the plan.
A 12th co-op served by Cajun Electric, Teche Electric Cooperative, is being acquired by Central Louisiana Electric co and did not vote as a member co-op.
Each creditor in the Cajun Electric bankruptcy case had the option to vote for one or more plans and then prvide a ranking for those plans which the creditor supported.

Among all creditors 197 voted on the Entergy/SWEPCO proposal, 187 for and 10 against; 207 on Enron's, 195 for and 12 against, and 190 on the trustees plan, 16 for amnd 174 against, SWEPCO'S statement said.
The bankruptcy court begins its hearings on the plan Monday, and Wednesday the Louisiana Public Service Commission hears its advisor's opinion of the three proposals.
The commission is expected to make a decision on what to recommend to the court after the hearing, SWEPCO spokesman Peter Main said.
There could be a decision from the bankruptcy court in January, he added. ((-- Jim Brumm 212-859-1710.))
